ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2-3 hours peer week
6 hours
6 hours
Course Materials (PPT slides etc) and lectures are really good for understanding.
10 hours per week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: too many materials covered in this half semester class and it is hard for students who does not have previous advanced knowledge of epidemiology study to follow and catch up.
Very informative class, but the homework assignments were a lot of work and the final exam although seemingly straightforward was not so clear.

This course teaches important analytical methods using in epidemiological studies. The topics are important. But lots of them are covered by other classes here.I've heard that Maria plans to drop this course and extend survival analysis to the whole semester. I think that's a good idea.
The course provides necessary and useful skills. The only weakness is that the course only lasts for half of a semester, so we are unable to learn some in-depth topics.
Excellent course, really provided depth to my understanding of when to use different analyses
Strengths: very kind instructor, excellent slidesWeaknesses: it took hours to complete the homework and the homework was too detail oriented and involved too many calculations

Excellent course for each biostat student. It details all important epidemiological concepts (although I find it repetitive, since I learned this from other epi courses), and biostats concepts...her lecture notes are the best and surprisingly flawless. I am sure she puts hours and hours into this course. her notes are the best in the field...Although this was a half sem course, I learned so much more from this course than from other "key" biostat courses like "categorical"
I did not like this course, it was very repetitive and between intro epi and categorical data analysis there was not much new material
Well taught, very clear, and slides were extremely well organized and detailed.

Excellent summary of biostatistics for epidemiology with comprehensive notes. Strengths include the detailed lessons and useful assignments. Weaknesses include the final assessment, which included limited time to answer the given questions.
Very good and detailed lecture notes, lecture a little rushed
Fantastic course! Filled in a lot of the gaps from the Fall course in Categorical Data Analysis.

This is a very good course. Its main strengths are that it integrates basic epidemiology concepts with several useful statistical tests, and that the lecture notes are regularly very good for the homeworks and studying for exams.
very nice job, super applied
good. but if the instructor stops reading the lecture notes, the it could be better.
Wonderful! Wish I had her earlier!
a lot of redundant materials for biostat students
Excellent.
Course Materials (PPT slides etc) and lectures are really good for understanding.
Good overall. Very useful and clear materials.
Great course, learned a lot and found the material interesting
strengths: incredibly well taught and essential course for public health professionals and epidemiologists alike; homework with SAS problemsweaknesses: should potentially be a longer course

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Great!

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Wonderful teacher with a real ability to communicate the information clearly and effectively. She also has the best and most informative slides of any biostats professor.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Mario is a excellent instructor, providing one of the best slides.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is a great instructor.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is very responsible and helpful. Her lecture notes are very organized and clear.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Amazing slides- really great professor!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very knowledgeable, very kind instructor.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  her lecture notes are the best and surprisingly flawless. I am sure she puts hours and hours into this course. her notes are the best in the field...Although this was a half sem course, I learned so much more from this course than from other "key" biostat courses like "categorical"
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  I really enjoyed Maria as a professor except I did not like the subject matter.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria clearly explained concepts, and the class flowed in a very logical way.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent instructor.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is very good for providing explanations in class, and is always open to questions.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  very nice job Maria, I like your teaching!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  a little boring. Overall good.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Wonderful instructor!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  extremely helpful after class! one of my best profs in the dept
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Really good at teaching
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Course Materials (PPT slides etc) and lectures are really good for understanding.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  very good!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is a fantastic instructor with clear slides. Her classes can be a bit dense sometimes, but overall very good.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Professor Ciarleglio is wonderful - she is in the top 10% of professors that I have encountered in nearly one decade of higher education. She is patient, thorough, and passionate about her subject matter, as well as helping students.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Great TA
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Great TA and very responsive to questions.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Very helpful
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe is a great TA.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  I did not attend the TA session, but Kyaw gives timely response to homework questions.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Could have prepared better in advance for the lab sections
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  He is wonderful, he was really helpful during the office hours. Thank you Joe.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Very knowledgeable, very kind TA.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  very good
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe was a great TA and was very easily reached.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  The TA was helpful.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Very timely responses to any queries and caring of his students.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  good TA
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  He is a very good TA. He was supportive all the time, either in office hours or by email.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Good Job
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  sometimes careless about the homework. overall good.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Also great!
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  helpful after class, nice and reachable
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Responsible
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Really nice
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  very good!
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Good effort, but sometimes can get a bit confused and flustered. Kind person.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe was great! He is very approachable and thorough in his feedback.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Only to students who have taken advanced epidemiology studies or who are majored in biostatistics. Not a good class for students who have limited knowledge of epidemiology study design and analysis
A really informative class, but also considerable work. Definitely worth it, though, in terms of being able to understand the concepts.
recommend
Useful course. I would definitely recommend it to other students.
YES- particularly if you ever want to do Epi research
Take this class if you like biostatistics.
very good course. Some epidemiological concepts were repetitive. However,she covered many topics that were either not covered or unclear from other 600 level biostat courses.
This course is a basic intro to different epi designs and logistic regression. Very repetitive if you took intro epi and categorical
I would recommend this course, as it is well taught and the materials are very clear and comprehensive.
Highly recommended as a good foundation for biostatistics in epidemiology.
good course

I would recommend it. It is a really good course either for students with a background in biostatistics but no previous epidemiology background or for other students that are interested on integrate what they have learn in different biostatistics courses plus some advanced topicsnot covered in previous classes.
yes. it's helpful.
a little bit not challenging
Good to learn if you haven't taken categorical.
Course Materials (PPT slides etc) and lectures are really good for understanding. Worth taking it.
Good
